|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = China

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== '''Emtec''''s drivers note the chip used as RTL8709. <small> :This would seem to be another name for RTL8192U (RTL81xxSU is aka RTL8712) - :the USB ID is noted in the Linux driver for '''r8192u_usb''' which handles those devices. </small> :It is presumed to be using RTL8192U + RTL8256...
Based on the dongle's appearance, ''[[Edimax]]'' is the presumed manufacturer.
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.emtec-international.com/de-eu/old_drivers Drivers on '''Emtec''''s site] *[http://forum.ubuntu-it.org/viewtopic.php?t=363139 Appears to have a 0bda:8709 USB ID]
[[Category:English Documentation]]
